history.content: I am in the same position as you are. Adjustment period begins on August 13th, which is actually before the deadline to submit the declaration (August 15th). And to my knowledge, declarations usually takes a few weeks to get processed, so there really is no way of bypassing the waitlist.

I am in the same position as you are. Adjustment period begins on August 13th, which is actually before the deadline to submit the declaration (August 15th). And to my knowledge declarations usually takes a few weeks to get processed, so there really is no way of bypassing the waitlist.

children.subject: To my understanding 170 tends to be a class that extends until everyone gets in. I heard that it is even possible to get in by adding it during the adjustment period because some people drop. If I were you, I would phase 2 it and hope that the major declaration kicks in before the end of the adjustment period, but you are very likely to get in

The CS declaration normally doesn't officially process until after phase 2 and the middle of the semester (at least for me it was like that cuz I also did 70 over the summer). Even then, 170 is by far the easiest upper div to get into, so that shouldn't be a problem for you.

history.content: Hi, I will be taking CS70 over the summer in the hopes of declaring before fall so that I can take 170 in the fall of 2018. Is it possible to declare after the summer so I can move up on the waitlist as a declared CS major, or is there no such process?
history.subject: Declaring After Summer
